Join ASA!
June Training Series
American Student Assistance® (ASA) has designed a training series to discuss some of the most pressing topics affecting financial aid.
Dates and Times:
June 8, 2009 - Rensselaer at Hartford - Hartford, CT June 12, 2009 - Springfield College - Springfield, MA June 26, 2009 - American Student Assistance - Boston, MA June 29, 2009 - College of the Holy Cross - Worcester, MA
Agenda 10:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Regulatory Update 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. Professional Judgment and Needs Analysis
Lunch will be provided with full day attendance.
Please register for each topic you plan to attend at your preferred location.
Topics:
Regulatory Update - Morning Session 10:00 a.m. -12:00 p. m. With the numerous changes these past few months, from Schools Code of Conduct to School disclosures, make sure you’re on the right track to implementation of applicable regulations. Ensure that you have the latest information, and join us while we discuss the overall changes that affect schools.
Professional Judgment & Needs Analysis During Difficult Economic Times -Afternoon Session 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. During these tough economics times college staff will need to respond to difficult situations regarding job loss, retirement fund depletion and other financial loss. This session will cover the basics of Professional Judgment and also how to use Professional Judgment to assist a family in financial crisis.
Who Should Attend: School financial aid administrators interested in the most up to date information.
How to register or for additional information.
· Register online: http://www.amsa.com/fap/training/index.cfm
· Email: send your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com
· Phone: call the Training Department at (800) 999-9080, ext. 3099 (1-617-728-4200)
Note: Please register for all the sessions you plan on attending.
All American Student Assistance training events are offered free of charge. Training is considered one of the guarantor's core responsibilities and ASA is dedicated to providing informative and useful training events for our industry colleagues.
